items.content_html:
• In general, should link to w3c.github.io spec versions rather than www.w3.org/TR — because many of the www.w3.org/TR are out of date, while the w3c.github.io versions always reflect the latest changes.

  • In general, should link to the closest heading ID, when it makes sense, not necessarily to the most-specific dfn ID — because linking to the heading immediately orients the reader/developer, with more context, in a way that linking deeper in doesn’t.

    For example, a developer following a link to the specific anchor https://w3c.github.io/gamepad/#dfn-gamepad won’t even see the “Integration with Permissions Policy” heading, because they get scrolled past it. But a developer following a link to https://w3c.github.io/gamepad/#permission-policy will immediately see the heading and the entire content of the section — so it provides more context and clarity for them as a reader.
items.title: Update spec URL for gamepad permission policy

items.content_html:
Working on mdn/content#7751

The system-ui value for font-family is shipping in Firefox 92.
items.title: system-ui support in Firefox 92

items.content_html:
Working on mdn/content#7752

The accent-color property is shipping in Firefox 92.
It is also shipping in Chrome 93: https://chromestatus.com/feature/4752739957473280
items.title: accent-color shipping in Firefox 92 and Chrome 93

items.content_html:
Part of mdn/content#7754

Firefox 92 ships the font-size-adjust CSS property, and the size-adjust descriptor.
items.title: Firefox 92 ships size-adjust and font-size-adjust

items.content_html:
The existing data is mostly false with these few exceptions. Link to
crbug.com/1100993 for all interfaces and navigator.bluetooth.
items.title: Mark Web Bluetooth as not supported in WebView

items.content_html:
The RTCIceCandidate constructor takes an (optional) options dictionary that is named RTCIceCandidateInit in the spec. My understanding is that we're removing dictionaries and enums across MDN and BCD, so I have moved this with structure as shown

RTCIceCandidate
    RTCIceCandidate constructor
       option
            option_candidate
            option_spdMid
            etc.

Note, the dictionary looks like it appears BEFORE the constructor as shown below. But I this is because the option appeared as a moz prefix in the earlier versions.

Further (not done yet):

  1. The RTCPeerConnection.addIceCandidate() also takes this as an options - just follow same process for that?
  2. The RTCIceCandidateInit is also returned by RTCIceCandidate. toJSON() - same process for that?
  3. When all that done, I just delete the RTCIceCandidateInit in BCD?
items.title: RTCIceCandidate - init dictionary into options

Test results and supporting details

items.title: docs(HTMLElement.inert): add missing spec

items.content_html:
Content work is getting done in mdn/content#7662

XRAnchorSet is a Set-like object and it makes no sense to me to create those sub-pages on MDN. (Also, I don't want to fall into into this trap now. It is filed in #6367)
items.title: Add mdn/spec urls for WebXR anchors

items.content_html:
Summary

Firefox 92 added support for the keywords avoid-page and avoid-column of the break-inside property. See bug 1722945.

While I was on that I realized that the descriptions were wrong. They included the keywords column and page which are only available for break-before and break-after (see https://www.w3.org/TR/css-break-3/#break-between and https://www.w3.org/TR/css-break-3/#break-within). So I removed them.

Test results and supporting details

https://jsfiddle.net/SebastianZ/qukjxtyh/

Sebastian
items.title: Adds avoid-page and avoid-column support for break-inside for Firefox

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Chrome and Safari for the HashChangeEvent API, based upon manual testing.

Test Code Used:

if (location.hash === '#foobar') {
	location.hash = '#foo';
} else {
	location.hash = '#foobar';
}

window.addEventListener('hashchange', function(event) {
	alert(event.oldURL);
	alert(event.newURL);
});
items.title: Add Chrome/Safari versions for HashChangeEvent API

items.content_html:
This PR corrects real values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the HashChangeEvent API, based upon manual testing.

Test Code Used: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HashChangeEvent#foobar
items.title: Correct Chromium versions for HashChangeEvent API

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for all browsers for the FileReader API. The data for the events was copied from their event handler counterparts. Data for the other features was mirrored from Chrome to Chrome Android and Samsung Internet. Finally, any mentions of Safari 6.1 was corrected to Safari 7, since we are removing the 6.1 backport data.
items.title: Add all browsers versions for FileReader API

items.content_html: This PR adds real values for all browsers for the Document API. The data was copied from their matching event handlers (such as in GlobalEventHandlers).
items.title: Add all browsers versions for Document API
